articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends New Year Cards to Foreign Party and State Leaders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends New Year Cards to Foreign Party and State Leaders 
   Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent New Year cards to party and state leaders of various countries on the occasion of Juche 96 (2007).
 The addressees include Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and President of the People's Republic of China, Fidel Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, President of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, V. Putin, President of the Russian Federation, and party and state leaders of Laos, Lebanon, Maldives, Mongolia, Bangladesh, Syria, Cambodia, Thailand, Pakistan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Jordan, Uzbekistan, India, Yemen, Vietnam, East Timor, Malta, Monaco, Moldova, Belarus, Croatia, Ukraine, Guinea, Rwanda, Madagascar, Mauritius, Burkina Faso, Zambia, Tanzania, Algeria, Angola, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Dominica and Trinidad and Tobago.    
 He also sent New Year cards to the chairman of the Committee of the African Union, the director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea who is secretary general of the "International Kim Il Sung Prize" Council, the secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and the secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea.

Repeal of NSL and Disbandment of GNP Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repeal of NSL and Disbandment of GNP Demanded in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Ryu Son Min, chairman of the Preparatory Committee for the Formation of the 15th-term south Korean Federation of University Student Councils, reportedly released a statement on Jan. 28 in which he demanded the repeal of the "National Security Law" (NSL) and the disbandment of the "Grand National Party" (GNP) standing in the way of reunification.
 Recalling that on Jan. 23 the Seoul Central District Court declared not guilty the victims of the "case of the Committee for the Reconstruction of the People's Revolutionary Party," a case faked up by the fascist dictatorial regime in 1974, the statement urged the need to thoroughly probe the truth behind the case with the recent court ruling as a momentum.    
 Cases aimed at binding patriotic youth and students hand and foot are being faked up one after another and innocent people are thrown behind bars and forced to stand trial on charges of "receiving instructions from the north" and the like which are nothing but abnormal practices, though the nation lives in the June 15 era for reunification, the statement deplored.

Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Syria
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Syria 
   Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift, a big floral basket and a congratulatory message from Lieut. General Hassan Turkmani, deputy commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces and minister of Defence of Syria, on the occasion of his birthday.
 A vice-director of the Section of Protocol of the Organizational and Administrative Department of the Ministry of Defence was authorized to convey them to the DPRK ambassador to Syria on Jan. 22.

Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Spanish Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Spanish Ambassador
   Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Delfin Colome, Spanish ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and a staff member of the Spanish embassy here.    
 After receiving the credentials, Kim Yong Nam conversed with the Spanish ambassador.

Lecture Given to Mark Sri Lanka's Independence Day
articles.content:
Lecture Given to Mark Sri Lanka's Independence Day
   Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A lecture was given at the Chollima House of Culture today on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of the independence of Sri Lanka. 
 Present at the lecture were the chairman of the Korea-Sri Lanka Friendship Association and its members.    
 The chairman at the lecture referred to the achievements made by the government and people of Sri Lanka in their efforts to achieve national reconciliation and unity and build a new prosperous society.
